name: Swayambhunath (Monkey Temple)
description: Ancient Buddhist temple complex atop a hill with stunning valley views and resident monkeys.

name: Pashupatinath Temple
description: Sacred Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, a UNESCO World Heritage Site on the Bagmati River.

name: Boudhanath Stupa
description: One of the largest Buddhist stupas in the world, a center of Tibetan Buddhism in Nepal.

name: Kathmandu Durbar Square
description: Historic palace complex showcasing traditional Newari architecture and ancient royal palaces.

name: Garden of Dreams
description: Beautiful neo-classical garden with pavilions, fountains, and peaceful walking paths.

name: Narayanhiti Palace Museum
description: Former royal palace turned museum showcasing Nepal's royal history and artifacts.

name: Asan Bazaar
description: Traditional market in the heart of old Kathmandu, famous for spices and local goods.

name: Thamel
description: Tourist hub with restaurants, shops, bars, and accommodation options.

name: Chandragiri Hills
description: Hilltop destination offering panoramic views of the Himalayas and Kathmandu Valley.

name: Patan Durbar Square
description: Ancient royal palace complex with exquisite Newari architecture and stone carvings.

name: Golden Temple (Hiranya Varna Mahavihar)
description: 12th-century Buddhist monastery famous for its golden facade and intricate metalwork.

name: Kumbheshwor Temple
description: Ancient five-story pagoda temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its unique architecture.

name: Mahabouddha Temple
description: Unique Buddhist temple made entirely of terracotta tiles, each depicting Buddha images.

name: Bhaktapur Durbar Square
description: Medieval royal palace complex with stunning pagoda temples and traditional architecture.

name: Nyatapola Temple
description: Five-story pagoda temple, the tallest in Nepal, dedicated to goddess Siddhi Lakshmi.

name: Pottery Square
description: Traditional pottery-making area where visitors can watch artisans create clay vessels.

name: 55-Window Palace
description: Historic palace famous for its 55 intricately carved wooden windows and traditional architecture.

name: Dattatreya Square
description: Ancient square with the Dattatreya Temple and traditional Newari buildings.

name: Phewa Lake
description: Serene freshwater lake with stunning Annapurna mountain reflections and boating opportunities.

activities.name: Boating
activities.title: Boating on Phewa Lake
activities.description: Peaceful boat ride with mountain views and visits to Tal Barahi Temple.

name: Sarangkot
description: Popular viewpoint for sunrise over the Annapurna mountain range and paragliding launch site.

activities.name: Paragliding
activities.title: Paragliding from Sarangkot
activities.description: Tandem paragliding with stunning aerial views of Pokhara valley and mountains.

name: World Peace Pagoda
description: Buddhist pagoda offering panoramic views of Pokhara valley and the Annapurna range.

name: Davis Falls (Patale Chhango)
description: Unique waterfall that disappears into an underground tunnel, also known as Patale Chhango.

name: Gupteshwor Cave
description: Sacred limestone cave with natural formations and a hidden view of Davis Falls.

name: Bindhyabasini Temple
description: Ancient Hindu temple dedicated to goddess Bhagwati, offering city views.

name: International Mountain Museum
description: Museum dedicated to mountains and mountaineering history, culture, and biodiversity.

name: Mahendra Cave
description: Large limestone cave with stalactites and stalagmites, named after King Mahendra.

name: Bat Cave
description: Natural cave system home to thousands of bats, located near Mahendra Cave.

name: Chitwan National Park
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site famous for one-horned rhinos, Bengal tigers, and diverse wildlife.

activities.name: Elephant Ride
activities.title: Elephant Safari in Chitwan
activities.description: Traditional elephant-back safari through the jungle to spot wildlife.

activities.name: Canoeing
activities.title: Canoe Ride on Rapti River
activities.description: Peaceful canoe journey to observe crocodiles and riverside wildlife.

activities.name: Jungle Safari
activities.title: Jeep Safari in Chitwan
activities.description: Guided jeep tour through the national park to spot tigers and rhinos.

name: Bishazari Tal (20 Thousand Lakes)
description: Wetland area with numerous small lakes, perfect for bird watching and nature walks.

name: Chitwan Tharu Village
description: Traditional Tharu village showcasing indigenous culture, dance, and lifestyle.

name: Sauraha
description: Tourist hub and gateway to Chitwan National Park with resorts and safari operators.

activities.name: Elephant Ride
activities.title: Elephant Safari from Sauraha
activities.description: Jungle elephant ride to explore wildlife and vegetation.

activities.name: Canoeing
activities.title: Rapti River Canoeing
activities.description: Scenic canoe ride along the Rapti River with wildlife spotting.

activities.name: Jungle Safari
activities.title: Wildlife Safari from Sauraha
activities.description: Guided jungle safari to observe tigers, rhinos, and other wildlife.

name: Elephant Breeding Center
description: Conservation center dedicated to breeding and caring for Asian elephants.

name: Rapti River
description: Major river flowing through Chitwan, perfect for canoeing and wildlife observation.

name: Maya Devi Temple
description: Sacred Buddhist temple marking the exact birthplace of Lord Buddha.

name: Ashoka Pillar
description: Ancient stone pillar erected by Emperor Ashoka in 249 BC to mark Buddha's birthplace.

name: Sacred Garden
description: Peaceful garden surrounding the Maya Devi Temple and Ashoka Pillar.

name: Lumbini Monastic Zone
description: International monastery complex with temples built by different Buddhist countries.

name: World Peace Pagoda
description: Japanese-built Buddhist pagoda promoting world peace and meditation.

name: Tundikhel
description: Open grassland area offering panoramic views of the Himalayas and surrounding valleys.

name: Siddha Cave
description: Large limestone cave system with impressive stalactites and stalagmites.

name: Thani Mai Temple Viewpoint
description: Hilltop temple offering spectacular sunrise views and mountain panoramas.

name: Khadga Devi Temple
description: Ancient temple dedicated to goddess Khadga Devi with traditional architecture.

name: Gorkha Durbar
description: Historic palace complex and birthplace of King Prithvi Narayan Shah, founder of modern Nepal.

name: Gorakhnath Temple
description: Sacred Hindu temple dedicated to Guru Gorakhnath, offering panoramic valley views.

name: Upallokot Viewpoint
description: Scenic viewpoint offering stunning views of the Himalayas and Gorkha valley.

name: Rani Mahal
description: 19th-century palace built by Khadga Shumsher Rana, showcasing European architecture.

name: Sitalpati
description: Scenic viewpoint offering breathtaking views of the Himalayas and surrounding hills.

name: Amar Narayan Temple
description: Ancient pagoda-style temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu with intricate wood carvings.

name: Shreenagar Hill
description: Hill station with beautiful sunrise views and hiking trails through pine forests.

name: Kalika Temple
description: Sacred temple dedicated to goddess Kalika, popular pilgrimage site with mountain views.

name: Baglung Suspension Bridge
description: Long suspension bridge over the Kaligandaki River offering scenic valley views.

name: Gaja View Tower
description: Observation tower providing panoramic views of the Dhaulagiri and Annapurna ranges.

name: Muktinath Temple
description: Sacred Hindu and Buddhist temple complex at 3,710m altitude, known for its 108 water spouts and eternal flame.

name: Kagbeni
description: Ancient fortified village at the gateway to Upper Mustang, featuring traditional Tibetan architecture.

name: Namobuddha
description: Sacred Buddhist site where legend says Buddha offered his body to a starving tigress, featuring ancient stupa and monastery.

name: Dhulikhel View Tower
description: Panoramic viewpoint offering stunning sunrise views of the Himalayas including Everest on clear days.

name: Seti Gandaki Gorge
description: Deep limestone gorge carved by the Seti River, creating spectacular white cliffs and turquoise waters.

name: Tatopani Hot Springs
description: Natural hot springs with therapeutic properties, popular stop for trekkers and locals seeking relaxation.

name: Beni Bazaar
description: Gateway town to Mustang region, bustling market town at the confluence of Kali Gandaki and Myagdi rivers.

name: Manimukunda Park
description: Urban park with gardens, walking trails, and recreational facilities for families and visitors.

name: Bageshwori Temple
description: Ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Bageshwori, important pilgrimage site for devotees.

name: CG Temple
description: Modern temple complex offering spiritual experiences and panoramic views of the surrounding landscapes.

name: Martyr's Memorial Park
description: Memorial park dedicated to fallen heroes with monuments, gardens, and walking trails.
